note.p: Education: MA (University of St Andrew's); Paris; Montpellier; Valence (MD 1657); Incorporated doctor of physic at Oxford (1660)
Career: Physician to the Duke and Duchess of York; travelled abroad; practised in Edinburgh
Proposer: Alexander Bruce, Earl of Kincardine, and Sir Robert Moray (13 May 1663)
Date of ejection/withdrawal: 18 November 1675 (due to non-payment of arrears)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Munk's Roll; DNB; Foster; ODNB

Notes: The election date is Bruce's election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows.
